item.title: Perl Module Names Are Filepaths - And That's All
item.description: It’s common in Perl parlance to treat the words “module” and “package” as synonyms, and in practice they almost refer to the same thing. A module name is shorthand for a filepath, but a package name refers to a namespace within the Perl symbol table. It’s easy to forget this because module names and packages are written in the same colon-separated notation, and conventionally we give packages the same name as the module filepath.
